programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A Miami auction presents Ton Jones and Allen Haff with a big score, including a Delta Relay Rocket and a camouflage hovercraft, but they struggle to make a good profit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chicago, where they find a 1984 Yamaha snowmobile, a rare autographed baseball glove and a 1950s Robby the Robot toy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders have a mysterious new rival at an auction in the historical town of DeSoto, where a collection of Willie Nelson memorabilia is up for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor manages to turn Bubba against Ricky at an auction in a wealthy suburb of Dallas.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is challenged to convert a 1960s Volkswagen Beetle into a child's bed.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The storm is followed by a flood which drives the alligators inland, forcing the hunters to stalk their prey across unfamiliar terrain.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Muskrats prevent a shrimper from setting sail, while wild hogs pose a direct threat to a property developer.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman heads to New Orleans in pursuit of a coyote that is on the loose, then tries to stop an invasive species from destroying the Louisiana swampland.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum check out a water-propelled jetpack and a statue of the Hindu god Shiva is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rescue buoy from the set of Baywatch signed by David Hasselhoff is brought in, as well as two flintlock blunderbuss pistols. Rick and Corey check out a six-person solar bike.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate reports of bird-like figures that practised advanced medical science in ancient times, considering whether or not they could have been extra-terrestrial.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Texas has been a hotbed for extraordinary UFO activity for decades. As Hangar 1 digs into some of the Lone Star State's most unusual and best-known cases, patterns point to Texas's unique role in a larger government conspiracy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit a country town with a thriving art scene, and Victor competes to buy an antique train set.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Carrollton, where the lots up for auction include hunting gear and glass-blowing equipment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a bass guitar signed by Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones and The Who's John Entwistle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a rare 1589 manual for war practices and fortifying defences after it is brought into his store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a coffin inside a storage unit in Chicago and hope it does not contain any unpleasant surprises. They also find a collection of toxic grenades.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders take on wealthy opponents at an Ontario auction, where they find a remote-controlled model of a Viper FanJet aircraft and a 1920s field camera.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend auctions in Cedar Hill, where they compete over voodoo statues, boxes of barbecue sauce and prosthetic limbs from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders compete over collectible dolls, antiques and a strange coin, which supposedly has the means to prevent the end of the world.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how the lives of FedEx flight 705's crew were placed in jeopardy when they came under attack from a hijacker above Memphis.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious relics that have been revered by cultures for millennia, considering if these sacred items truly hold divine or otherworldly power.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is intrigued by a lot containing high-quality tools and antique furniture, but struggles to outbid his new rival. Plus, a 1930s dynamite detonator box is discovered.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys unearth an 1897 Winchester 16-gauge shotgun and a pair of stuffed animals on their visit to Orange County.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists explore world mythology as they investigate whether extraterrestrials could be responsible for mankind's existence, having visited from other planets with Earth-like characteristics.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.sub-title: Beyond the War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Documentary investigating almost every UFO and alien sighting ever recorded, raising theories of governmental cover-ups, conspiracy theories and suggestions that the truth may really be out there. The series begins by chronicling the history of HG Wells' The War of the Worlds, a story that has captivated and shocked audiences for more than 100 years.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts the comedy quiz, welcoming guests Greg Davies, Simon Evans and Micky Flanagan, who join him to offer opinions on world events in an edition from 2011. With Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert is at the centre of some satsuma-based controversy and Phil Wang finds his Bruce Lee costume offers an unexpected advantage.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with comedian Sara Pascoe and former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Bill Bailey, Eddie Izzard, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the host asks questions on the topic of house and home, and awards points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Rhianna Pratchett, the writer behind the rebooted Tomb Raider series, joins Ellie Gibson, Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon to add another title to the Hall of Game.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon and guest Keza MacDonald.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle revisit the best moments from the series' 11 stunts, the biggest wins and losses and there are even some previously unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick samples some delights in Peckham at two imaginatively named eateries, tasting a bao bun at Mar Bao and some tapas at Miss Tapas.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick heads for rural Essex, where he mucks in as he grinds his own meat, plucks turkeys and hunts rabbits in a farm-to-fork experience.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys meet a former arms dealer and her judo champion husband, and make a killer back-room deal.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Scott hope to strike it lucky as they compete for ten-pin bowling equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott, Brandon and Lori hope to strike it rich in Las Vegas, but Dustin and Dan are betting big too.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: On a family compound near New York City, a staggering collection of A-list mannequins leaves Mike speechless.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys meet a scientist who can create lightning and hypnotises Frank.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat builds in darkness to meet his deadline. Andre and Joel have a problem when the forklift they need to finish a store gazebo does not fit through the door.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John and Dave get rid of unwanted skips and trailers, which are home to some unusual objects. Elsewhere, emergency repairs are required to get two police bikes back out on the road.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in their bid to build scrap cars. This time, they're up against pro driver Shane Lynch's Chevrolet Camaro in a plane-pulling contest. Building scrap able to get the 40-ton monster rolling will require innovation and a super-sized imagination..

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around Â£2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The series reaches its majestic climax. Who will win Greg Davies's coveted golden head to become just the seventh Taskmaster Champion in history?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Jimmy Carr, writer Steven Moffat and singer Rochelle Humes to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include sandy beaches, other people's opinions and being Scottish.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Line of Duty star Vicky McClure, comedian and writer Sandi Toksvig and comedian and presenter Josh Widdicombe to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include real ale, hotel leaflets and coat hangers.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Jo Caulfield joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Warwick Davis, Paul Hollywood, Jason Manford and Joan Bakewell join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers a developing fluid has mutated, causing photographs to come to life and giving Lister a chance to change the past and avoid ever becoming lost in deep space. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers his expiry date is less than 24 hours away, prompting Lister and Rimmer to organise a party he will never forget, but when the mechanoid decides to avoid being shut down he does not realise his actions could cost the rest of the crew their lives. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Lucy goes on a wild night out in London with TV personality Alan Carr, while back in Hebden Bridge, Jon spends the night with his best friend, Matt Forde.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Secret Viking Grave of Ridgeway Hill
programme.desc: Archaeologists investigate the discovery of a mass grave in Dorset, and try to determine if the bodies are the remains of Vikings.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history, beginning with a man from Bermondsey who vanished without trace in 1849.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team help the Bamburgh Research Project uncover the Saxon roots of the local fortress.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a children's home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. When an artist's impression of a skeleton found in an archaeological dig matches one of the youngsters, the team tries to determine the identity of the paedophile. Starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: JT unwittingly puts a woman's life in jeopardy by sending her to the house of serial rapist Alan Kennedy, forcing Samantha and Terry to abandon a covert surveillance operation and rush to her rescue. Reg and Tony arrest two squabbling burglars and Smithy urges Gina to give up smoking, while Ramani is astounded to overhear Margaret and Roger discussing her love life - or lack of one.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy steps in when tensions run high between Pearce and Bayleaf. Sicknote is still attracting unwanted attention. The crew is called to a dangerous situation in a coldstore.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The day of Major Kieran Voce and Captain Kate Butler's wedding arrives. Meanwhile, Donna Tucker starts to get closer to her tutor.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: JT unwittingly puts a woman's life in jeopardy by sending her to the house of serial rapist Alan Kennedy, forcing Samantha and Terry to abandon a covert surveillance operation and rush to her rescue. Reg and Tony arrest two squabbling burglars and Smithy urges Gina to give up smoking, while Ramani is astounded to overhear Margaret and Roger discussing her love life - or lack of one.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A distraught Jess finds herself at the centre of a baby shaking scare after struggling to cope with Paris's incessant crying. When the infant suddenly goes quiet, she rushes him to hospital, where bruises are found on his body. Mickie is rejected for medical training and finds herself being manipulated by Donna, while patients' lives are put at risk as Michael is blackmailed by a face from the past.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Trouble brews for a band of environmental protestors faced with eviction, Max's son is admitted after overdosing on heroin and then causes a furore by discharging himself against George's advice. And, as if he didn't have enough to cope with, Charlie learns Eve has booked extended leave for her expedition to Romania.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete is stood up by Rose but then has a pleasant surprise. Aidan sleepwalks in the Square, and Ricky tries to to save his marriage but Sam leaves abruptly in a cab.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky makes one last effort to save his marriage and Sam comes to a decision. Frank tries to help Pat face going to court. Rachel gets fed up with market life.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George is aggrieved to learn his father has cancer, and Nick saves a boy's life, but hurts himself in the process. Meanwhile, Bayleaf finds himself up in front of the magistrate.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie believes he has a solution to the estate's crumbling finances - but his new bank manager arrives with plans of her own. Meanwhile, down at the local golf club, Hector's old-fashioned views about lady members provoke serious resistance. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: While attending a fashion show as a guest of Danielle's cousin, Jim witnesses a shooting and see somebody running off. He decides to put his detective skills to use and investigates, desperate to find a missing link. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline continues to believe in her phantom pregnancy, Billy discovers Julie has a new lover and Jack goes for a job as a handyman.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin commissions a statue of himself and issues strict instructions for the unveiling - paving the way for more chaos and confusion at the holiday camp. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel suffers embarrassment when he walks in on Sandy in the bath, and once the sniggers subside Jean decides to have a second bathroom installed and calls in the builders. As the tension increases, she realises a minor incident has been turned into a major issue that she can ill afford.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists the help of Aunty Wainwright to become a master of disguise and deceive his secret enemies, and is delighted when Marina is attracted to his new looks - to the great annoyance of Howard. Meanwhile, a misunderstanding over a neck injury puts the police on Alvin and Entwistle's trail.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects murder at what first appears to be the double suicide of a wealthy high-society couple, who are found floating in their pool.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne is in high spirits after meeting a new woman on a night out, but his joy is cut short when she is found dead the following morning. It soon transpires the victim was living under a false identity and gathering evidence against a money-laundering ring, but as the team struggles to piece together the clues, Richard hears the news he has been longing for - his old job is available if he wants it. It looks like the Caribbean cops will be solving this murder without their British DI. John Thomson guest stars, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Danny John-Jules and Gary Carr.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a 1970s guitarist is investigated following the deathbed confession of a witness. Strickland, a fan of the rock star's band, reveals himself to be a keen musician, while Brian tracks down Jack and persuades him to rejoin Ucos. With guest appearances by Roger Lloyd Pack and George Costigan.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Feeling the full force of DI Renton's investigation, Laura looks to those closest to her for support, but when suspicions fall on Ian, she is left questioning who she can trust. Seeking answers, she turns to a former ally, but the information she gleans only fuels her concerns. Meanwhile in the past, Oliver brings Andrew some devastating news, leading him to make a reckless and dangerous excursion. Jack and Harry Williams's thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Katherine Kelly and Sam Spruell.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: PhillipÂ Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the grand final of the skating challenge. Joe Swash, Libby Clegg and Perri Kiely and their professional partners remain in the contest, and each pair is challenged to perform a special showcase routine choreographed by Christopher Dean and Jayne Torvill. After that one pair will be eliminated, with the other going on to the final round - performing their own take on Torvill and Dean's signature piece, Ravel's Bolero. And as if that were not enough, the entire cast of this year's show will return to the ice for one last performance.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: A healthy gut can do more than help digestion. It is being linked to everything from obesity levels to mental health. Five years ago actress Catherine Tyldesley made a film for Tonight about diets. Now she is back to find out exactly what people need to know about keeping the digestive system in good working order.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the fourth and final day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Magners Cheltenham Gold Cup Steeple Chase, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jimmy is surprised by what he learns, Samson comes clean to a shocked Vinny, and Andrea is given an idea on how to set up Kim.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff tries to persuade Yasmeen that Alya is out to get him, while Gary convinces Maria that he did nothing to provoke Ali and that the guy is a maniac. Audrey worries that Ken is being railroaded into moving to Stillwaters against his will, and Imran puts pressure on Toyah to find a new job.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: The chalk-and-cheese detective duo are called to a private clinic where a wealthy patient has been killed. However, their investigation is made all the more difficult by the complex relationships of the victim's former fellow residents. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia take the lead roles in the second of two mystery dramas, with an all-star supporting cast including Caroline Catz, Hugh Dennis, Michele Dotrice, Freddie Fox, Suzanne Packer and Joanna Scanlan.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make a bicycle which can fold up to a tenth the size of a regular bike. Plus, the process behind the making of a Borsalino hat worn by Indiana Jones.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than Â£4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a luxury bike for Mercedes Benz-AMG, and Paul Tuetul Sr asks a local artist to give him a tattoo of his children.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dan takes a 1926 Ford Model T as part-payment and Robby wants to convert it to a rarer 1914 C Cab. Anthony buys a 69 Chevrolet Camaro Convertible, but it's in a mess.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe pays tribute to the dirtiest American Presidents, revealing the secrets of their pets.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of powder horns, hand-crafted moulds, pierogies and inner tubes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Where materials come from and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years, featuring lace, antique frame replicas, orchids and unicycle wheel hubs.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Investigating how a 1000-ton ship is lifted 70 metres into the air while it is still in water, and how criminals are prevented from cracking credit cards.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Memorable moments featuring items that brought in major sums of cash or turned out to be near-worthless.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: One of the boats is lost in the typhoon, but as the weather clears, the crews must move on from the tragedy and return to work as quickly as possible.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell Miklos seeks clues from Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper's past, and while his widow reveals many secrets, one of his former Nasa colleagues remains silent on the subject of treasure.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work transforming an old Mazda MX5, removing the leaking roof, rusty wings and seats.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The air filter, chassis brace and wheels of the Mazda MX5 are fixed, and the new roof is fitted before Mike Brewer takes the completed car for a test drive.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini decides to buy a 1956 Porsche 356 Cabriolet on the recommendation of a friend.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini fixes a clients 1962 Triumph TR4 racing car for sale, and after months of negotiations he collects a 1963 250 GTL Ferrari Lusso.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Memorable moments featuring items that brought in major sums of cash or turned out to be near-worthless.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: The documentary exploring the work of staff manning a 500-mile long Alaskan railroad returns as a rogue gunman threatens a military hardware delivery.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Wizard's resident greenhorn is forced to endure a humiliating tirade from the ship's deckboss, and the crew of the Lisa Marie arrives with a point to prove.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Late summer's weather drives the dredges off the best spots, while Steve loses his dredger to the repo man.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard buy quirky items in Dorset. Twin sisters show their late father's legacy - vintage cars and steam train memorabilia. Plus, a visit to Luton's oldest hat makers.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi prepares for a showdown with transport police in South Australia. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo take on one of their toughest jobs yet on one of Australia's worst roads.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than Â£4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.sub-title: Picks of the Rich and Famous
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks, related to the rich and famous.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: After tracking Hitler's attempts to return to power through wealthy supporters in Argentina and Brazil, the investigators hits the ground in South America. An FBI report places Hitler in Colombia after unloading from a plane. Bob and John identify the marsh where they believe this aircraft was hidden, and gain access to use side-scan sonar to locate what could be the Nazi plane that shuttled Hitler to within 2,000 miles of the United States.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts investigates Harry Houdini's illusions, revealing the secrets behind his death-defying torture escape stunt.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make the Fender Stratocaster electric guitar, and a look at the way Swedish fermented cod roe Kalles caviar is made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the gravity-defying 'magic' behind Pisa's leaning tower. Plus, the making of chocolate digestive biscuits.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In the 1980s and '90s, there were around 200 murders and attacks on sex workers across the Midlands. Stafford man Alun Kyte was later found to be responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man reports that his 10-year-old daughter has disappeared from his front yard, but police grow suspicious when all the clues point back to him.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Katherine Foster's shooting in Alabama in 1980, and how new evidence emerged three decades later leading detectives to her killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Kelly Eckart, an 18-year-old who disappeared after finishing her shift at an Indiana hardware store in September 1997. Her car was discovered abandoned by the side of the road still running, and four days later her partially naked body was found in a ravine. Workman Michael Overstreet was eventually convicted of the crime after eyewitnesses reported seeing him in the area and DNA evidence provided a solid link.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bureau investigates a Puerto Rican liberation movement known as the Macheteros, whose members claim responsibility for an attack on 18 unarmed servicemen near San Juan.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team springs into action when a dog and her nine puppies need rescuing from a storm drain before the rain arrives.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown takes on his most frightening mission ever, rescuing a trapped snake. He also helps an endangered turtle and has a shocking discovery with puppy Tyson.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Maria brings three generations of her family to her appointment, while Pamela is on the hunt for a grand ballroom-style dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy has a surprise in store for a military veteran planning her wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Joelle tries on her mother's dress from the 1980s, and another customer declares herself the anti-bride.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown travels to the Barossa Valley in South Australia to help an orphan lamb. Plus, Tim Faulkner learns about a breeding programme for the Tasmanian Devil.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown treats a baby cheetah, a shaking cavoodle and a pig.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: A Polar Bear in the City
programme.desc: Twenty-six-year-old polar bear Tundra is one of the New York's Bronx Zoo's favourite inhabitants. However, after his behaviour changes, keepers worry about injury or signs of disease.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals for which owners Lynette and David want big money. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How convictions were secured in three murder cases through the gathering of trace evidence, including luminol blood testing and fingerprinting.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Jarrod Johnston, who was 17 years old when he vanished shortly after leaving his grandmother's Mississippi home in July 2007.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case involving the disappearance of two 16-year-old girls, where two serial killers separately confessed to their murders.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori seeks out the perfect dress for an insecure bridesmaid with body image issues, while Emily's insulting outbursts threaten to ruin her friendships.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Helena wants her eight bridesmaids to wear a different vintage dress as Lori tries to prevent the bride's vision from looking like chaos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride wants short and revealing dresses for her bridesmaids but must convince her religious mother and sister. Plus, another bride struggles to make a decision without her mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori's team tries to keep sibling rivalry in check between two sisters getting married within 30 days of each other. Plus, a country bride tries to control her bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Jump for Joy with Your Country Cousins
programme.desc: A bride refuses to pick a dress unless her whole family agrees on it. Plus, another bride tries to find a dress that satisfies both her fiance and sister.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore oversees the renovation of a sewing machine, a tin bath and a box of old taps acquired from a tip in Surrey. Artist blacksmith Bex takes on the challenge of the bath, turning it into a designer delight, while the sewing machine is transformed by furniture guru Rupert, and Sarah takes on the taps herself. The hope is that all three items will secure a profit thanks to their overhaul.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna offer medical advice to a husband and wife who have a combined weight of 52 stone, and a 21-year-old mother whose enjoyment of life is restricted by her J-cup breasts.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: A detective tries to prove a woman was strangled to death by her own son, and adopts the role of a disappointed father while interrogating his suspect.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened in her patient's final minutes.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The case of Sabrina Kouider, the ex-girlfriend of Boyzone founder Mark Walton who was jailed for life for the murder of a French nanny.
